name: Tanzania
takeaway: Despite a few years of lukewarm relations between Tanzania and China, especially during the presidency of John Magufuli, Tanzania's new administration seems to have rekindled the relations with PRC. President Samia Suluhu Hassan signed deals with President Xi Jinping in September 2022 when she visited Beijing.

The construction of the Mwalimu Julius Nyerere Leadership School (MJNLS) with the help of PRC signals the emphasis on academia in China's efforts to influence state policy and political parties. There is therefore a need to study the role of the party school in China's party-to-party diplomacy.

There has been increased military cooperation between China and Tanzania especially after the opening of the Chinese built Comprehensive Training Centre (CTC). In 2022 and 2023, there were joint naval training exercises off the Indian Ocean coast as the two countries extended their long-standing defence and military training partnership to the naval domain.
description-1: In 2023, Tanzania had a GDP per capita of US$1,211 and a total population of 65.66 million people.
description-2: The PRC established diplomatic relations with Tanganyika and Zanzibar in 1961 and 1963 respectively but when the two countries united as Tanzania, the PRC extended its diplomatic relations to the united entity in 1964. Tanzania was ranked 123/180 in Reporters without Border’s 2022 World Press Freedom index and ranked partly free in Freedom Status in Freedom House’s 2022 Global Freedom Status with a score of 34/100

Media.evidence: Xinhua news agency has its bureau in Dar es Salaam. Also, StarTimes, a Chinese media company jointly owned by Tanzania Broadcasting Corp operates in the country
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The Media Council of Tanzania is a member of the Belt and Road Journalists Network
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There are reports of journalists and social media influencers who are paid to retweet and like tweets from the Chinese embassy in Tanzania.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: An interview with a Tanzania scholar studying in China pointed out that there are journalists who are sponsored to go to China for training. In another interview with a beneficiary of the training program, the journalist who worked for the state radio narrated his experiences working at the Radio China in Beijing as part of the training.
Media.note: The interview with the journalist who benefitted with the program also spoke of how Radio China sponsored what they called cultural diplomacy across different Chinese cities.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: China Radio International broadcasts in Swahili to Tanzanian Audience
Media.note: Many African countries have English or French as their official language, but still quite a number of people speak local languages, and cannot understand English or French due to poor education. In order to make African audiences understand TV programs, StarTimes launched a Swahili dubbing contest in Tanzania in 2016. Happiness Stanslaus Lulikela stood out among several thousand competitors and got a chance to work in the StarTimes headquarters in Beijing
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There are a few media outlrts wholly or partly owned by PRC affiliated entities.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is a joint venture agreement between Startimes and Tanzania Broadcasting Corporation (TBC) through which it broadcasts in the country
Media.note: This is a link to the About us section on StarTimes tanzania: https://m.startimestv.com/browser/aboutus
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: This happens through its content-sharing agreement with local media organisations such as Tanzania Broadcasting Corporation
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Interview with Tanzanian academic specializing in China-Africa
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: With the close ties between PRC and the ruling party CCM, there are some instances where there are calls for journalists to write positive stories on China. Chinese ambassador in Tanzania tends to ocassionally write Opeds in the local dailies.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There are no reporters/commentors who deny the existence of human rights abuses in PRC. Tanzanian journalists tend to mostly write on PRC-Tanzania relations and may not necessarily look into issues that go beyond economics, trade.
Media.note: Tanzania has remained silent on the PRC treatment of Uyghur population. Other African states seen in the link have defendeed China's massive detention of Muslims.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There are friendship links between the Tanzanian parliament and PRC
Foreign Policy.note: In November 2022, the National People’s Congress (NPC) of China has expressed its willingness to strengthen exchanges and cooperation with the Tanzanian Parliament at all levels. See link: https://dailynews.co.tz/chinas-npc-pledges-stronger-ties-with-tz-parliament/
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Just like many African states, Tanzania receives significant foreign aid from PRC. In 2022 for example, the Mwalimu Julius Nyerere school was opened. It was constructed with the help of the PRC.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Mwalimu Nyerere Leadership School in Kibaha will provide a platform for government leaders to be trained. The school provides a platform for China to enhance exchanges with leaders as a form of “party-to-party” diplomacy.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There has not be been a reported case on denial of visa or unfair legal treatment but there have been reports on Tanzannians been arrested for drug tranficking crimes in China
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During a state visit to China in 2023, President Samia Suluhu Hassan and President Xi Jinping  jointly announced the elevation of China-Tanzania relations to a comprehensive strategic cooperative partnership, and agreed to deepen the high-quality Belt and Road cooperation between the two countries.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: On several government outlets and speeches by government officials, the policy is a one China policy.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During a meeting with Chinese foreign Minister in 2021, Tanzanian Foreign Minister Palamagamba Kabudi noted that Tanzania regards China as its most trustworthy and staunch friend and partner. The Tanzanian government will always support China's position on issues related to Taiwan, Xinjiang, Tibet, Hong Kong and the South China Sea.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Chinese phone giant Huawei has signed several partnerships with Tanzanian universities to strengthen digital economy.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence:
At least three universities in Tanzania have Confucius Institutes.
There is a Confucius Institute at the University of Dar es Salaam, University of Dodoma and Muslim University of Morogoro.
Academia.note: The Confucius Institute at the University of Dar es Salaam was established in 2013 under an agreement between the University of Dar es Salaam, the Chinese International Education Foundation, and Zhejiang Normal University.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are plans by the government to gradually introduce Chinese as a language in both primary and secondary schools. For example, a select number of secondary schools have began teaching Chinese.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: In Tanzania, China has been able to promote its own policy and political interests through joint research programs to enhance the operationalization of the Belt and Road initiative and the Chinese model of conducting international relations. In addition, Chinese experts have constantly participated in in seminars and conferences organized by Tanzanian think tanks to promote China’s view on the various issues on partnership
Academia.note: The Institute of African Studies Zhejiang Normal University (IASZNU) and the University of Dar es Salaam (UDSM) in June 2023 began collaborative efforts to establish the Centre for Mwalimu Julius Nyerere and African Liberation Movement Studies-East Africa which will act as a joint think tank between the two countries
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The Confucius Institute at the University of Dar Es Salaam is a research institute for langauge, technology and culture. This related program is fully funded by the Confucius Institute until 2023.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Tanzania has participated in the LUBAN workshop aimed at promoting skills and technological pursuits for youth at higher insitutions of learning.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Interview with Tanzanian academic who has benefited from such a trip.
Academia.note: China and Tanzania have a long history of people – to- people academic exchanges to solidify their relations based on mutual cultural exchanges and development. The four major forms of exchanges include student exchanges, cultural exchanges, academic conferences, and medical exchanges
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Interview with Tanzanian academic specializing in Tanzania - China relations based in a Tanzanian university.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no evidence that scholars or academics have been denied visas to travel to PRC.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: In 2022, a leadership school funded and built by the Chinese Communist Party to train political party officials in southern Africa was opened in Tanzania.
Academia.note: The Mwalimu Julius Nyerere Leadership School, for which China’s ruling party provided US$40 million in funding, was opened by Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan and several neighboring countries’ leaders. The school is in Kibaha and will serve political parties in the region and be a platform for China to enhance exchanges with them as a form of “party-to-party diplomacy”

Academia.evidence: There is no evidence pointing to scholars who have published articles that echo PRC views.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The way the government is structured in Tanzania leaves no room for sub-national government involvement in external matters. National government does all engagements with external actors.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Tanzania's Dar es Salaam has twin city ties with Changzhou and Liuzhou, while Zanzibar City has twin city ties with Haikou
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In April 2023 for example, Wang Yi, director of the Office of the Foreign Affairs Commission of the Communist Party of China Central Committee, met with participants of a Chama Cha Mapinduzi National Executive Committee workshop led by CCM General Secretary Daniel Godfrey Chongolo in Beijing
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: For example, in 2022 Tanzanian president Samia Suluhu Hassan visited China on an official state visit. The two leaders The two sides spoke highly of their cooperation gains in such areas as culture, tourism, education, public health, pandemic response, sports, youth, think tanks and media, and agreed to further expand people-to-people and cultural exchanges.

Domestic Politics.evidence: While there is no clear evidence showing that the CCP has donated money to any politician in Tanzania, the CCP donated to the ruling Chama Cha Mapinduzi (CCM) towards the building of the building of China's first political school in Tanzania that started in July

Technology.evidence: Interviews with government officials and Tech businesses establish evidence of PRC-connected entities provide telecom services.China Unicom Global has launched operations in Tanzania to support digital transformation, with an emphasis on 5G

Technology.evidence: "In Tanzania, for example, China International Telecommunication Construction Corporation (CITCC), the Chinese company contracted to deploy the national ICT broadband backbone (NICTBB), constructed it to be compatible only with Huawei routers. Such practices further entrench Chinese technological standards in African countries and afford a competitive advantage to Chinese firms, in this case Huawei, in subsequent bids to construct or upgrade telecoms infrastructure."
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: Afrobarometer suggests this is the case in Tanzania
Society.note: An Afrobarometer survey done in collaboration with Tanzania’s research firm REPOA done in 2015 found that China’s development model was favored by 35% of the respondents. The report also found that a majority of Tanzanians say China’s economic activities in Tanzania have “some” or “a lot” of influence on the Tanzanian economy.

Military.evidence: Tanzania Imports from China of Military Weapons, Other than Revolvers, Pistols was US$4.79 Thousand during 2022, according to the United Nations COMTRADE database on international trade. Tanzania Imports from China of Military Weapons, Other than Revolvers, Pistols - data, historical chart and statistics - was last updated on October of 2023.

Military.evidence: Tanzania is totally import-dependent on military equipment. There is no evidence to suggest that Tanzania currently exports military or law enforcement equipment or components of equipment to China. Rather, the relationship in terms of military equipment appears to be primarily one where Tanzania is the recipient of such equipment from China.
